09:53 <esdaniel> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <esdaniel> good morning... i guess this hack-tip request will be for cjdelisle :-) how do I hide page title on home page?  
09:56 <lucaa1> esdaniel: not really. What do you want to do? only on Main.WebHome you don't want the title of the page to appear? the "Welcome to your wiki" thing ?  
09:57 <esdaniel> hi lucaa1 - yeah, just remove doc title on home page  
09:57 <vmassol> esdaniel:  this is not possible OOB. You have 2 ways to do this? 1) Add a SSX to use CSS to hide the title (the easiest) or 2) modify viewcontent.vm  
09:57 <vmassol> I suggest 1)  
09:58 <esdaniel> thanks vmassol: to clarify i would just need to add #document-title { display-none;} and not the whole css?  
09:59 <vmassol> esdaniel: yes, see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial  
10:00 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <esdaniel> :-) sweet, done, nice one chaps!  
10:05 <lucaa1> ( esdaniel: I was gonna say the same thing, I just got caught in smth else. vmassol thanks for backing up )  
10:06 <rstavro> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <+mflorea> vmassol: did you experience any issues with selenium2 regarding sendKeys not setting the value? I have a file input, I use send keys, the input if filled and WebElement.getValue() returns my value, but the JavaScript validation fails because the input is "empty"..  
10:21 <vmassol> mflorea: I don't recall any recent issue with sendkeys  
10:21 <+mflorea> ok, thanks, I'll dig  
10:21 <vmassol> oh you mean the livevalidation test  
10:21 <vmassol> in RegistrationTest  
10:21 <vmassol> right?  
10:21 <+mflorea> no, it's a custom validation I have on WYSIWYG editor  
10:22 <vmassol> because we have something potentially similar in RegistrationTest, some flickering that I don't understand  
10:22 <vmassol> it may or may not be the same  
10:23 <+mflorea> in my case the validation fails all the time

15:01 <jstoldt> okay, thought you might have run into it again and figured something out...  
15:01 <jstoldt> but it's fine  
15:02 <@cjdelisle> Nope, I know as much as you. Finding out more will mean reading their source or running it in gdb  
15:19 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <venkatesh> has quit  
15:42 <+jvelociter> hmm our checkstyle rules refuses parameter reassignment ?  
15:43 <vmassol> yes  
15:43 <vmassol> findbugs too  
15:43 <vmassol> AFAIR  
15:43 <+jvelociter> OK  
15:44 <+jvelociter> I'm working on XWIKI-4885  
15:44 <+jvelociter> but I won't have time for a complete refactoring  
15:45 <+jvelociter> so I think I will just add the XWikiLDAPUtils to the exclude list and list why it fails  
15:45 <vmassol> http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/config\_coding.html#ParameterAssignment  
15:46 <vmassol> what method is it?  
15:47 <+jvelociter> it's syncUser from XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl  
15:47 <+jvelociter> which I'd like to move in LDAP utils  
15:47 <vmassol> what assignment are you doing?  
15:48 <vmassol> I don't see why it would take more than a few seconds to fix (hence my question)  
15:48 <vmassol> I guess it's this line: userProfile = createUserFromLDAP(userProfile, searchAttributeList, ldapDn, ldapUid, context);  
15:49 <+jvelociter> vmassol: the problem is that I don't know if there is code relying on that behavior aldready  
15:49 <+jvelociter> and I think there is  
15:49 <+jvelociter> but I could change the signature  
15:49 <+jvelociter> yes it's this one  
15:49 <+jvelociter> I could do return userProfile  
15:50 <vmassol> I think it's not correct  
15:50 <+jvelociter> I'm a breaking signatures anyway  
15:50 <vmassol> indeed you're changing siganture  
15:52 <vmassol> you could also modify createuserfromldap so that it doesn't return anything  
15:52 <vmassol> if the idea is to pass an existing xwikidoc and have it partly filled by the method  
15:53 <+jvelociter> I feel less safe doing that though  
15:53 <+jvelociter> the userProfile is used again after the syncUser  
15:54 <+jvelociter> if it remains the original one, maybe the behavior is affected afterwards  
15:54 <+jvelociter> I would need to retrieve it again  
15:55 <+jvelociter> thought the name cannot change it seems  
15:55 <+jvelociter> so it would be safe to retrieve again maybe  
15:56 <vmassol> it looks to me like syncUser is about updating the passed XWikidocument when needed  
15:56 <+jvelociter> yes that's what it does  
15:56 <+jvelociter> but the passed object , userProfile, is used afterwards  
15:56 <vmassol> and since createUserFromLDAP is passed a xwikidoc too  
15:57 <vmassol> it seems to me that createUserFromLDAP is also updating the passed xwikidoc  
15:57 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:57 <+jvelociter> hum, you mean the reassignment is in fact useless ?  
15:57 <+jvelociter> you are right  
15:57 <+jvelociter> then I can just remove it  
15:58 <vmassol> I'm not sure  
15:58 <vmassol> I'm reading code  
15:58 <vmassol> might not be that simple  
15:58 <vmassol> right now createUserFromLDAP only uses the name/refernce of the passed xwikidoc  
15:58 <abusenius> has quit  
15:59 <+jvelociter> acutally I think we can't just remove it  
15:59 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
15:59 <+jvelociter> createUserFromLDAP returns another document if you look at it  
16:00 <+jvelociter> it returns the same document BUT retrieved again against XWiki  
16:00 <vmassol> sure that's what I'm saying, ideally it only need a name passed to it (name or ref)  
16:00 <+jvelociter> (and in between createUser() has been called)  
16:00 <vmassol> actually it's a bit wrong  
16:00 <+jvelociter> so you can't be sure it's the same thing  
16:00 <vmassol> it's using getName() to create the new user  
16:00 <lucaa1> has quit  
16:00 <vmassol> but then loads the doc using getReference()  
16:01 <vmassol> so if you're not in the same wiki it's going to fail....  
16:01 <vmassol> but that's another issue ;)  
16:03 <vmassol> got to go  
16:03 <vmassol> phone call  
16:03 <+jvelociter> k  
16:04 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <+jvelociter> you've thrown some doubts and now you leave me, thank you :)  
16:04 <+jvelociter> ;)  
16:16 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:45 <arkub> has quit
